website_summaries.verdict: For anyone looking to enhance their keto diet, or ones aiming to increase their energy and mental clarity, this tasteless and odorless oil is a must.
pros: This MCT oil is virtually tasteless, odorless, and doesn’t leave oily residue
Mixes well with coffee and other foods
Provides energy but doesn’t induce jittery feeling
Increases mental sharpness and curbs appetite
cons: Should be introduced to diet gradually to mitigate risk of stomach irritation

customer_reviews.title: Very good. Be very careful using.....
customer_reviews.text: Very Good stuff. A little Expensive. Take it easy as with any mct oil until your digestive system get used to it. I'd recommend bringing an extra pair of underwear with you wherever you go during your first week. Seriously.
customer_reviews.author: NHgunguy

customer_reviews.title: Best MCT oil!
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite brand of MCT oil! I use it daily in my morning coffee. I'm loving the bottle too. It does not drip or make a mess like other brands I've used. Super high quality!
customer_reviews.author: Colleen_Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Beware of Poor Packaging
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived completely smashed, all the oil has drained out and I’m met with no return or refund for this product.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Concerned!
customer_reviews.text: No question, this provides more energy. However the plastic lid on the coffee that I purchase every morning has split open 3days in a row. Also the little tab that you pull back to sip through has broken off. Never happened in 40 years, until this week, which coincided with me starting the MCT oil. This makes me a little concerned...if the MCT oil is causing this (and I'm sure it is), what is it doing to my stomach?
customer_reviews.author: falcon70

customer_reviews.title: Made from coconuts!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried other brands only to find out after the fact that they were a blend of coconut and palm oil. This is the best one I've found for price and value. I use it every day in my box. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... definitely helps curb the sugar and carb cravings - great stuff - keep a bottle at the office too
customer_reviews.text: Heard about this on Adam Carolla and Dr Drew show and been using for months - a squirt into coffee in the am and I have half the appetite I use to - definitely helps curb the sugar and carb cravings - great stuff - keep a bottle at the office too.
customer_reviews.author: andrew j grillo

customer_reviews.title: Best MCT found!
customer_reviews.text: I just ordered my second bottle of Onnit MCT Oil. After trying other brands, I noticed less GI upset with Onnit using the same amount daily. I am not on the KETO diet (my husband is), I just notice benefits of the oil with one being decrease appetite. I have lost 10 lbs over 4 months using the oil with my morning coffee and the changes in my diet that came with the decreased appetite.
customer_reviews.author: DDWhit

customer_reviews.title: Messy and no benefits experienced
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t like this product at all nor did I notice any benefits from it. For starters, even when mixed in my coffee, it made my mouth and my mug super greasy. I then resorted to just taking it as a shot and it gave both my husband and I nausea, it felt like it just sat at the base of our throat leaving us feeling like we had to burp all day long. Never experienced any digestional benefits from it.
customer_reviews.author: LockdownLife

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and does what it claims
customer_reviews.text: I’m enjoying The keto diet and dropping pounds at a healthy steady and amazing rate. This product came as a recommendation from a fitness pro. I couldn’t be happier with my weight loss rate. I’m re ordering.

customer_reviews.title: Stay home after taking
customer_reviews.text: mu experience was not a good one I took it two days in a row, upon the second day I realized I had to go to the bathroom after lunch while shopping unfortunately I didn't make it to the bathroom in time. Stay close to home until you body is use to the product or the effects will not be pleasant.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn F. O'Such

It doesn’t rise to the top and separate like regular coconut oil does, so you actually end up consuming all of it instead of it sticking to the sides of your cup and getting 1 last gulp full of coconut oil.

This oil is definitely instant magic. Of course I am buying more of this product. I used to take medication for ADHD many years ago and this oil works with similar effects in terms of focusing on task.

product_meta.title: Onnit MCT Oil - Pure MCT Coconut Oil, Ketogenic Diet and Paleo Optimized with C8, C10, Lauric Acid - Perfect for Coffee, Shakes, and Cooking (Flavorless - 24oz)
feature_bullets: 100% pure premium MCT oil with lauric acid, harvested from coconuts. Onnit MCT Oil is sustainably sourced and contains no palm oil, the leading constituent in most MCT oils. Free of fillers, additives, and flavoring.

MCT (Medium Chain Triglycerides) are a beneficial fat that’s easily converted into fuel in the form of ketones, one of the brain’s primary sources of energy as well as a vital source of ATP energy for the body. Onnit MCT oil is excellent for those adhering to a ketogenic diet, which utilizes fats rather than carbs for energy, a state known as ketosis. MCT oil is a perfect supplement for other low carb diets, like the Paleo diet, and for weight management support.

Onnit MCT Oil is tasteless and odorless, making it great for smoothies, protein shakes, salad dressings, unheated sauces, and more. Not recommended for use with styrofoam or any other foam-based material.

Great with coffee. Onnit MCT oil is a bulletproof way to turn your morning cup of Joe into a creamy, delicious source of sustained energy for the day, supporting mental focus and clarity. Organic, Non-GMO, Vegan-Friendly.

A superior alternative to coconut oil for MCTs. Coconut oil is great, but it contains relatively small quantities of MCT’s, particularly C8 (Caprylic Acid) and C10 (Capric Acid). These two forms of MCT are especially valuable because they take fewer steps to convert to caloric energy than the other saturated fat forms found in coconut oil.
